item.title: Review: We Put ChatGPT-4, Bing Chat, and Bard to the Test
item.description: We designed trials to compare our chatbot overlords from OpenAI, Microsoft, and Google. They’re smart, they’re interactive—and they’re pretty little liars.
item.media:keywords: chatbots, artificial intelligence, Google, OpenAI, Microsoft
item.dc:creator: Lauren Goode
item.dc:subject: Product Review

item.title: In Sudden Alarm, Tech Doyens Call for a Pause on ChatGPT
item.description: Tech luminaries, renowned scientists, and Elon Musk warn of an “out-of-control race” to develop and deploy ever-more-powerful AI systems.
item.media:keywords: ChatGPT, Microsoft, Google, OpenAI, Elon Musk, artificial intelligence
item.dc:creator: Will Knight, Paresh Dave
item.dc:subject: Red Light

item.title: Red Teaming GPT-4 Was Valuable. Violet Teaming Will Make It Better
item.description: To keep up with the speed of AI advances, we need to develop systems that use AI to defend public goods, too.
item.dc:creator: Aviv Ovadya
item.dc:subject: Opinion

item.title: Microsoft's ‘Security Copilot’ Sics ChatGPT on Security Breaches
item.description: The new tool aims to deliver the network insights and coordination that “AI” security systems have long promised.
item.dc:creator: Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: Hack Hunter

item.title: Now That ChatGPT Is Plugged In, Things Could Get Weird
item.description: Letting the chatbot interact with the live internet will make it more useful—and more problematic, too.
item.dc:creator: Will Knight, Khari Johnson
item.dc:subject: Level Up

item.title: ChatGPT Opened a New Era in Search. Microsoft Could Ruin It
item.description: Startups say Microsoft and its Bing chatbot—not just Google—are stifling competition when it comes to creating better search engines.
item.media:keywords: Search, Google, Microsoft, Yahoo, Startups, Browsers, artificial intelligence, chatbots, ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Paresh Dave
item.dc:subject: Chatbot-opoly

item.title: To Hold Tech Accountable, Look to Public Health
item.description: The field of public health has transformed medicine, yet failed the most vulnerable. This trajectory can be avoided.
item.media:keywords: diversity, algorithms, ethics, artificial intelligence, public health
item.dc:creator: J. Nathan Matias
item.dc:subject: Ideas

item.title: 11 Tips to Take Your ChatGPT Prompts to the Next Level
item.description: Sure, anyone can use OpenAI’s chatbot. But with smart engineering, you can get way more interesting results.
item.media:keywords: learning, voice assistants, artificial intelligence, ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: David Nield
item.dc:subject: Hello World

item.title: Is GPT-4 Worth the Subscription? Here’s What You Should Know
item.description: The new algorithm is exclusive to ChatGPT Plus, OpenAI’s subscriber-only service. We signed up and put it to the test.
item.media:keywords: OpenAI, ChatGPT, artificial intelligence, how-to, advice, subscriptions

item.dc:subject: Power Prompter

item.title: For Smarter Robots, Just Add Humans
item.description: Autonomous machines are still too clumsy for delicate tasks. But humans can operate mechanical arms from afar, turning physical labor into remote work.
item.media:keywords: Fast Forward, robotics, robots, artificial intelligence, logistics, Labor, Work, remote work
item.dc:creator: Will Knight
item.dc:subject: Fast Forward
